introduction.p: Consider 18 \times 18 matrix N = \begin{bmatrix} N_1 \\ \amp N_2 \\ \amp\amp N_3 \\ \amp\amp\amp N_4 \\ \amp\amp\amp\amp N_5 \end{bmatrix} in triangular-block nilpotent form, where the elementary nilpotent blocks N_1 and N_2 are each 5 \times 5, blocks N_3 and N_4 are each 3 \times 3, and block N_5 is 2 \times 2.
Suppose A is another 18 \times 18 matrix that is similar to N.

statement.p: What is the rank of A?
What is nullity of A ( the dimension of the null space of A)?
Describe how and why this number determines the number of blocks in N.
What is the first power of A that is zero? Describe how and why this number determines the size of the largest block in N.
